title: The Last Librarian of Elsewhere
premise: A terminally ill archivist, Leo, discovers his ability to open portals to other worlds is not a curse but a genetic key—one that a ruthless interdimensional corporation wants to harvest and weaponize. To survive, he must unite a ragtag band of exiled magical beings he accidentally summoned to his dying world: a guilt-ridden warrior, a starving poet-goblin, and a sentient, melancholic clockwork owl. Together, they must find the mythical 'Stacks of Avalon,' a library at the heart of all realities, not just to save their own worlds, but to redefine what family means when you're literally from different dimensions.
protagonist: Leo Vance, a 58-year-old archivist with a terminal diagnosis and a secret he's always considered a mental illness: he can 'read' objects and open temporary doors to the places they describe.
conflict: Leo must protect his newfound, chaotic family from corporate hunters while learning to control his powers, all before his illness claims him or his 'key' is extracted—a process that would collapse the unstable portals, stranding his friends and dooming countless refugees across the multiverse.
setting: Modern-day, rain-soaked Seattle and the myriad, decaying realms of the 'Elsewhere,' a multiverse connected by narrative and memory rather than physical laws.
tone: Hopeful melancholy; a blend of heartfelt character drama, whimsical discovery, and high-stakes survival against a gritty, corporate-antagonist backdrop.
